maintank.name: Main Tank
maintank.explanation:
As a main tank, you'll be responsible for using Lost Aethershield on the party during raidwides on Trinity Avowed and The Queen. Lost Sacrifice can be used to resurrect a player if the raid is low on Lost Arises.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

offtank.name: Off Tank
offtank.explanation:
As an off-tank, youâ€™ll mainly be doing damage with Lost Font of Power + Banner of Honored Sacrifice. Lost Aethershield is needed for Queen enrage - youâ€™ll use it after the main tank uses both of their Aethershields. Lost Sacrifice can be used to resurrect a player if the raid is low on Lost Arises.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

mainhealer.name: Main Healer
mainhealer.explanation:
Main healers are responsible for applying Shell II to players at the box, as well as applying Protect II to any players standing on the north pad at the box.
Your main role is to resurrect players by using the Lost Arise action. When Arising players, stand over them and jump to make sure that other healers donâ€™t waste Arises on the same player.
At Queenâ€™s Guard, youâ€™ll slot Spellforge (if youâ€™re the only healer in your party, youâ€™ll need to slot both Steelsting and Spellforge). When the raid lead instructs you during Queenâ€™s Guard, youâ€™ll slot over Spellforge with Reflect, which youâ€™ll carry with you through the rest of the raid, if possible (both Minotaur and Queen have reflect mechanics).

offhealer.name: Off Healer
offhealer.explanation:
Your main role is to resurrect players by using the Lost Arise action. When Arising players, stand over them and jump to make sure that other healers donâ€™t waste Arises on the same player.
At Queenâ€™s Guard, youâ€™ll slot Steelsting for an upcoming mechanic. At Minotaur, youâ€™ll slot Dispel for mechanics that require dispel on both Minotaur and Queen.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if your main healer misses an orb.

melee-rend.name: Melee DPS (Rend)
melee-rend.explanation:
As a melee carrying Lost Rend Armor, youâ€™re responsible for making sure that bosses have the Rend Armor debuff. Youâ€™ll be assigned first or second rend in the roster - if youâ€™re first rend, youâ€™ll apply Rend Armor at the start of the fight, and every 60 seconds after that. If youâ€™re second rend, youâ€™ll apply Rend Armor 30 seconds into the fight, and then every 60 seconds after that.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

melee-dps.name: Melee DPS
melee-dps.explanation:
As a melee DPS, your main job is to deal damage. Thereâ€™s an extra Lost Rend Armor in your bag to use in case a primary or secondary Rend goes down, or for the initial phase of Queenâ€™s Guard where all four bosses need Rend applied to them.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

caster-c4.name: Caster (C4)
caster-c4.explanation:
As a Cure IV (C4) caster, your primary role is to apply Cure IV to the party every 60 seconds. Cure IV interacts with your Pure essence to apply a 10% bravery damage boost to your party. You can also use Cure IV to heal the party when your healers are busy (for example, using LB3) or dead.
Your pre-pop bag has three options for a damage action alongside Cure IV. For first-timers, Chainspell is the easiest action of the three to use. Lost Font of Magic is the preferred action for Black Mages, and for casters that want to deal extra damage. Resistance Ether Kits are required for non-BLMs carrying Lost Font of Magic. Banner of Honored Sacrifice is an option for Red Mages, since your burst phase is mixed physical/magic damage.
C4 Casters are also tasked with applying Shell II (and Bubble, if someone in the raid needs it) throughout the raid. If youâ€™re assigned as Shell II for a fight in the roster, youâ€™ll need to apply Shell II to players before we pull that boss. After applying Shell II, you can slot over it with Cure IV.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

caster-dps.name: Caster DPS
caster-dps.explanation:
As a DPS caster, your main role is to deal damage. You should slot Lost Font of Magic as your first pre-pop action. You can choose either Lost Chainspell or Banner of Honored Sacrifice (RDM only) as your secondary action. HSac is useful for Red Mages since their burst phase is mixed physical/magic damage.
Your main bag contains a Cure IV to use if your partyâ€™s C4 caster goes down during a fight. Resistance Ether Kits are required for this loadout, as FoM+CS will burn through your MP. If youâ€™re comfortable with some of the fights in DRS, drop a Reraiser to bring more ether kits.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

ranged-c2.name: Ranged DPS (C2)
ranged-c2.explanation:
As a Cure II ranged player, your primary role is to apply Cure II to the member of your party that requests it. Cure II interacts with your Pure essence to apply a MP regen over time to the player you cast Cure II on. This is useful for full-DPS casters, Profane White Mages, and the Duelist. Your second action can either be Lost Font of Power or Lost Dervish, depending on if your party has another Physical Ranged player in it.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

ranged-dervish.name: Ranged DPS (Dervish)
ranged-dervish.explanation:
As a Dervish ranged player, your primary role is to apply Lost Dervish every two minutes (within burst windows) during boss fights. Dervish is a party buff that increases critical hit rate and damage dealt, and reduces GCD and recast times. If you have two ranged players in your party, have one player offset their Dervish by 60 seconds to get full uptime.
You also have a Lost Perception in your bag. You can use this to percept traps after Phantom, and then slot a Lost Dervish over it once we get to Trinity Avowed.
Light Curtains are for the Queenâ€™s Sovereignty mechanic, where players must reflect orbs to create a safe spot. They can also be used on Queenâ€™s Guard if a healer misses an orb.

irregular-drk.name: Irregular (DRK)
irregular-drk.explanation: If youâ€™re looking at this loadout, you probably donâ€™t need tooltips. ðŸ˜€

savior-tank.explanation: If youâ€™re looking at this loadout, you probably donâ€™t need tooltips. ðŸ˜€

savior-tank.explanation: If youâ€™re looking at this loadout, you probably donâ€™t need tooltips. ðŸ˜€

profane-whm.name: Profane (WHM)
profane-whm.explanation: If youâ€™re looking at this loadout, you probably donâ€™t need tooltips. ðŸ˜€

main-tank.name: Main Aethershield Tank
main-tank.explanation:
When it comes time to swap to Lost Aethershield, you will replace Banner of Honored Sacrifice with Shell 2, use it on the raid, and then slot in Aethershield for the fight. Your only DPS action now is Lost Font of Power.

Check your raid's roster to see if you are assigned main aethershield. If this is you, you will be slotting aethershield at TA/Queen.

off-tank.name: Off Tank (Blue DPS)
off-tank.explanation: You pack Aethershield in case your party's main tank dies. If they die and do not reraise, slot aethershield over Honored Sacrifice immediately. Your main job now is to keep the party alive and help mitigate the raidwides form TA/Queen. After the fight is over you may swap back to your Honored Sacrifice (if you still have it).

healer.name: Healer
healer.explanation:
It is hard to make a guide for a proper healer bag. It is best to check your roster and see what extra actions you should bring along with you need with you (Dispel/Reflect). Steelsting can also be replaced by Spellforge as well as vice versa. Another good pointer is to shove as many arises as you can into your bag once you're done setting up the rest of your bag.

Chainspell is honestly a better option over Font of Magic for healers. Chainspell can be carried through most of the instance without much trouble with using a fresh single plate. As well as not being MP intensive as Font of Magic can be. Just make sure to be using Lucid on CD!

If you are assigned reflect, you can either bring the Lost Reflect action or bring 8-10 Light Curtain items. They do the same thing but the main trade-off is that Light Curtains do not take an action slot. This is for people who are comfortable taking their reflect orbs and can ration them well.

A second Seraph Strike is brought in case of needing to overwrite it. Healers should try to have a DPS action at all times to help DPS, but sometimes there are moments where needing double support actions is necessary to help the party/raid.

melee-dps.name: Melee (Full DPS)
melee-dps.explanation: You are the biggest damagers in the whole raid. Combine both Font of Power and Honored Sacrifice to get the biggest gains from these two buttons. This does mean you drift Honored Sacrifice by 30 seconds, but it's still a gain.

melee-rend.name: Melee (Rend Armor)
melee-rend.explanation: Chat with your co-render about rend order. Ideally one should be reapplied as the other one falls off. This is a huge raid damage gain so you do have an important job. Also, Rend Armor is a gapcloser, so be careful.

ranged-dervish.name: Physical Ranged (Dervish)
ranged-dervish.explanation: Having two physical ranged in a party is fine. Double dervish allows for 100% uptime on dervish and its benefits. This is great for duelist parties. This is a theoretical gain overall for the entire party.

caster-c4.name: Caster (Cure 4)
caster-c4.explanation:
Font of Magic is a huge gain, but the mana drain is too severe to suggest unless you're being fed mana by a Cure 2. Or, you're a complete masochist who hates having MP.

The rest of your space should be used on more ether kits. You'll be going through mana very quickly and ether kits can help mitigate the moments when Lucid Dreaming is on cooldown.

caster-dps.name: Caster (Full DPS)
caster-dps.explanation:
This is a mana intensive setup. It is suggested you bring Ether Kits to help keep your supply of mana from running dry too often. Red Mages can opt to use Banner of Honored Sacrifice as a replacement to Chainspell.

LFS can use this setup, but replace Chainspell with Lost Flare Star.

The rest of your space should be used on more ether kits. You'll be going through mana very quickly and ether kits can help mitigate the moments when Lucid Dreaming is on cooldown.

tank-advanced.name: Tank (Advanced)
tank-advanced.explanation: If your main tank dies during TA/Queen, swap Font of Power with Aethershield. Once the fight finishes swap back to Font of Power. You can practice Blood Rage on the dummies in the BSF/Zadnor zones.

solo-queen-tank.name: Solo Queen Tank
solo-queen-tank.explanation: This loadout is for GNB/PLD only. During Queen you have Aethershield and Font of Skill equipped. Invuln the first buster, then immediately use Font of Skill. Take the second buster with invuln. During Super Chess 2, Font of Skill comes back up to use again, allowing you to take the third buster. This means you can tank Queen without any tank swaps.

melee.name: Melee Pump
melee.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot HSac over Excellence
4. Use HSac and Font of Power
5. (Optional) Slot another HSac for 60 seconds of it!

ranged-dervish.name: Dervish Pump
ranged-dervish.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot Dervish over Excellence
4. Use Dervish and Font of Power

melee-battery.name: Melee Battery
melee-battery.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot HSac over Excellence
4. Use HSac and Font of Power
5. (Optional) Slot another HSac for 60 seconds of it!

ranged-battery.name: Dervish / Battery
ranged-battery.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot Dervish over Excellence
4. Use Dervish and Font of Power

caster-c4.name: Cure 4 Pump
caster-c4.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot Cure IV over Excellence
4. Use Cure IV and Font of Magic

caster-battery.name: Cure 4 / Battery
caster-battery.explanation:
Fill the rest of the holster with whatever you want/need.
Opener:
1. Mimic Battery before combat
2. Hit boss
3. Use Excellence, slot Cure IV over Excellence
4. Use Cure IV and Font of Magic

melee-standard.name: Standard (No Excellence)
melee-standard.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like.

ranged-standard.name: Standard (No Excellence)
ranged-standard.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like.

melee-rend-standard.name: Rend (Standard)
melee-rend-standard.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like.

caster-c4-standard.name: Cure 4 Standard (No Excellence)
caster-c4-standard.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like - preferably with Banner of Honored Sacrifice and Ether Kits.

tank-aethershield.name: Aethershield Tank
tank-aethershield.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like.

off-tank.name: Off Tank (Blue DPS)
off-tank.explanation: Fill the rest of your bag with whatever you'd like.

healer.name: Healer
healer.explanation:
Check the roster for any extra assignments, e.g. Banish.

If you have two healers, you'll only need one of Spellforge/Steelsting. Coordinate with your other healer to see who is bringing what.

melee.name: Melee
melee.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

melee-mimic-target.name: Mimic Target
melee-mimic-target.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

melee-rend-armor.name: Rend Armor
melee-rend-armor.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

melee-rend-mimic-target.name: Rend + 2x Mimic Target
melee-rend-mimic-target.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

phys-dervish-c2.name: Dervish + C2
phys-dervish-c2.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

phys-utility.name: Dervish + C2 (Utility)
phys-utility.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

phys-dervish-mimic-target.name: Dervish + Mimic Target
phys-dervish-mimic-target.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

caster-c4.name: Cure IV
caster-c4.explanation:
All C4 will be mimic targets unless specified otherwise.

If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

caster-c4-utility.name: Cure IV (Utility)
caster-c4-utility.explanation:
All C4 will be mimic targets unless specified otherwise.

If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

caster-c4-mimic-target.name: Cure IV + Mimic Target
caster-c4-mimic-target.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

caster-c4-utility-mimic.name: Cure IV (Utility & Mimic Target)
caster-c4-utility-mimic.explanation: If you need to mimic at Trinity Seeker (those running Incense+Mimic or Rampage+Mimic during door bosses), you can mimic any DPS with Font of Power/Excellence slotted.

healer.name: Healer
healer.explanation: Healers should slot some combination of Chainspell, Font of Magic, and Seraph Strike, depending on the amount of MP support they have. These can be used until utility actions need to be overwritten.

healer-utility.name: Healer (Utility)
healer-utility.explanation: Healers should slot some combination of Chainspell, Font of Magic, and Seraph Strike, depending on the amount of MP support they have. These can be used until utility actions need to be overwritten.

main-tank.name: Main Tank
main-tank.explanation: Blood Rage does more damage than Banner of Honored Sacrifice, but is harder to use. I suggest playing around with this in Bozja a bit and asking questions to get used to it.

off-tank.name: Off Tank
off-tank.explanation: Blood Rage does more damage than Banner of Honored Sacrifice, but is harder to use. I suggest playing around with this in Bozja a bit and asking questions to get used to it.

melee-rend.name: Rend
melee-rend.explanation: Lost Reraise is optional. If you don't bring them, replace them with extra Resistance Reraisers. Lost Reraise is only to be used before fights (not during), primarily on other players that might need it.

caster-c4.name: Cure IV
caster-c4.explanation: Lost Reraise is optional. If you don't bring them, replace them with extra Resistance Reraisers. Lost Reraise is only to be used before fights (not during), primarily on other players that might need it.

ranged-dervish.name: Dervish
ranged-dervish.explanation: Lost Reraise is optional. If you don't bring them, replace them with extra Resistance Reraisers. Lost Reraise is only to be used before fights (not during), primarily on other players that might need it.

tank.name: Tank
tank.explanation:
- If DRK, realistic scenario for necessary LD usage is 3: 
  - Trap sweep during slime/golem
  - Guard invuln mechanic (turret or aura sphere)
  - Trap sweep during mino
  Bring enough elixir to cover these in case a healer can't heal you out of living dead, i.e. no WHM bene.
- If there are 2 tanks in the party, the non-primary Aethershield tank should bring a 2nd DPS action in holster
- HAVE THE TANK DISCUSSION: 
  - If MT has a co-tank in party, co-tank will be responsible for Aethershield.
  - If MT has no co-tank in party, designate a non-unique DPS (Rank 16 or higher) as pseudotank and have them bring the pseudotank kit.
- If necessary, 1 Tank in entire raid will be responsible for Lost Protect (not Main tank)

healer.name: Healer
healer.explanation:
- Bring Spellforge XOR Steelsting, not both. HAVE THE HEALER DISCUSSION: Coordinate with cohealer or pseudohealer so one of you have steelsting and the other has spellforge.
  - If Healer has no co-healer, designate a non-unique DPS as a pseudohealer and have them bring the pseudohealer kit.
- A single Lost Reflect can be replaced with 4 Light Curtains IF THE HEALER KNOWS HOW TO TIME REFLECT DURING REFLECT MECHANICS. If in doubt, just bring 2 Lost Reflects and don't worry about it.
- I'm only asking for 3 Lost Arise per healer. If we have a mass-res situation after a fight, we will just exit and re-do the fight so people get more practice. If you bring more than 3, you'll be thanked, but realistically speaking "thanks" doesn't pay the bills.
- The "????" in the prepop means I don't know what you should have in your lost actions prior to jumping down to slime/golem. If I get better info I will update this graphic.
- Banner of Solemn Clarity is for healers with no Succor rays. Use this during the Queen fight while standing underneath the lightning orb shell the 2nd time it happens.

melee.name: Melee
melee.explanation:
- Banner of Honored Sacrifice has an interaction with melee pure essence that makes it 30 seconds and bleed for 1 HP per tick
- TWO melee IN ENTIRE RAID shall bring Rend Armor and keep as close to 100% uptime on boss (1 slotted, 2 in holster)

ranged.name: Physical Ranged
ranged.explanation:
- keep Lost Dervish generally on cooldown. Exceptions are when we call to hold burst (boss is untargetable, or we have downtime due to running)
- If you have an MP-hungry teammate, consider bringing Lost Cure II, as you have a hidden pure essence interaction that gives your heal target a 5000 MP refresh at the expense of a stacking slow debuff on yourself.

caster.name: Caster DPS
caster.explanation: - cast Cure IV to buff party with a strong 1-minute bravery, and keep bravery uptime as close to 100% as possible.  This is made possible through the caster pure essence hidden interaction.

pseudotank-caster.name: Pseudotank (Rank 16+)
pseudotank-caster.explanation:
Reason: Your team does not have a 2nd tank, and thus does not have a 2nd tank's party mitigations.

Notes:
- Pseudotanks are not running party/raid utility outside of Stoneskin II during TA/Queen.
- Lost Stoneskin II is slotted in pre-TA and kept in through Queen, cast it before and after each raidwide of concern to absorb both the initial hit and subsequent bleed
- It is possible, albeit rare, that no DPS in a given team can equip Lost Stoneskin II due to none of them meeting the Resistance Rank requirement to get the skill from the fragment. If this happens, that 8-man team will just assume the increased risk of having a complete party wipe during TA/Queen.

pseudotank-melee.name: Pseudotank (Rank 16+)
pseudotank-melee.explanation:
Reason: Your team does not have a 2nd tank, and thus does not have a 2nd tank's party mitigations.

Notes:
- Pseudotanks are not running party/raid utility outside of Stoneskin II during TA/Queen.
- Lost Stoneskin II is slotted in pre-TA and kept in through Queen, cast it before and after each raidwide of concern to absorb both the initial hit and subsequent bleed
- It is possible, albeit rare, that no DPS in a given team can equip Lost Stoneskin II due to none of them meeting the Resistance Rank requirement to get the skill from the fragment. If this happens, that 8-man team will just assume the increased risk of having a complete party wipe during TA/Queen.

pseudotank-ranged.name: Pseudotank (Rank 16+)
pseudotank-ranged.explanation:
Reason: Your team does not have a 2nd tank, and thus does not have a 2nd tank's party mitigations.

Notes:
- Pseudotanks are not running party/raid utility outside of Stoneskin II during TA/Queen.
- Lost Stoneskin II is slotted in pre-TA and kept in through Queen, cast it before and after each raidwide of concern to absorb both the initial hit and subsequent bleed
- It is possible, albeit rare, that no DPS in a given team can equip Lost Stoneskin II due to none of them meeting the Resistance Rank requirement to get the skill from the fragment. If this happens, that 8-man team will just assume the increased risk of having a complete party wipe during TA/Queen.

pseudohealer-caster.name: Pseudohealer
pseudohealer-caster.explanation:
Reason: Your team does not have a 2nd healer.

Notes:
- Pseudohealers are not running party/raid utility outside of the healer kit.
- A single Lost Reflect can be replaced with 4 Light Curtains IF THE PSEUDOHEALER KNOWS HOW TO TIME REFLECT DURING REFLECT MECHANICS. If in doubt, just bring 2 Lost Reflects and don't worry about it.
- The Lost Cure III should be used going into Queen soft enrage. Use in conjunction with Lost Cure IV (Lost Cure III is a GCD heal, Lost Cure IV is oGCD)
- A sole caster in a party running Lost Cure IV for bravery is not "also a pseudohealer", their Cure IVs are specifically for buffing the party with 1-minute 10% Bravery.

- A sole caster in a party running Lost Cure IV for bravery is not "also a pseudohealer", their Cure IVs are specifically for buffing the party with 1-minute 10% Bravery.
